meanings.definition: To measure or estimate the value or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: She will bemete the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: He always likes to bemete the distance before starting the journey.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to bemete the height of the tree by jumping.
meanings.sent4: The teacher will bemete our progress in the project.
meanings.sent5: Please bemete the time needed for the task accurately.

meanings.sent1: The panel will bemete the performances of the contestants.
meanings.sent2: It is important to bemete the situation before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to bemete the new toy with suspicion.
meanings.sent4: She could bemete the quality of the fabric just by touching it.
meanings.sent5: He will bemete the artwork based on creativity and skill.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement or estimation.
meanings.sent1: The bemete of weight for the fruit was accurate.
meanings.sent2: She checked the bemete of liquid in the container.
meanings.sent3: The bemete of time for the meeting was shorter than expected.
meanings.sent4: He carried the bemete of length to the construction site.
meanings.sent5: The bemete of distance between the two cities was displayed on the sign.
